Lake Yellowstone

P709

Archive: UNAVCO

Ellipsoidal Coordinates:

  • Latitude: 44.3917953

  • Longitude: -110.286006

  • Height: 2379.7 m

Station Page at UNAVCO

Station Page at UNR

Examine the Site

Reflection Zone App

Translate Data

rinex2snr p709 2022 1 -dec 5 -archive unavco -rate high -orb gnss

quickLook

quickLook p709 2022 1 -e1 5 -e2 10 -h1 20 -h2 40

Estimate Reflector Height

Set your analysis strategy using make_json_input. Remember, if the UNR database knows about the site, then you can input lat,lon,ht of 0,0,0.

rinex2snr p709 2021 183 -dec 5 -archive unavco -rate high -orb gnss

gnssir 2021 1 -doy_end 180

Use daily_avg to calculate a daily reflector height. Various statistics also come to the screen. Here is the RH series:

I am only showing the data for the new multi-GNSS receiver. If you look at earlier data, you are restricted to L1.

Note that the amplitudes (of the RH periodograms) are also a bit interesting.

Why do you think the amplitudes vary like this? What changes about Lake Yellowstone in the winter?

USGS station page

last year of data, USGS

Living in the US - you get to see feet instead of meters!
